Business_Process_Parameters.description: When set to "true" or "1", the business process is automatically processed. This means that all approvals will be automatically approved in the system, all reviews and to-do's will be automatically by-passed, and all notifications will be automatically suppressed.

Indicates the transaction should process to completion before the response is generated.  Note: All < v12 operations will process with Run_Now = True for backwards compatibility but please review this setting in your environment for performance conditions.

Enforces all validation conditions defined on the initiation step.  If any condition is true, the validation error blocks the step from exiting and a business process event isn't created. The attribute is currently not available for use. It will be generally available for all web services in a future release.

validation.validation: Discard on Exit Validation Error

Business_Process_Comment_Data.description: Free form comment regarding the business process.

validation.validation: This Business Process has been configured to disable comment. Please remove the comment or change the setting in the Business Process Policy or tenant setup.

WorkerObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

WorkerObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

WorkerObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Business_Process_Comment_Data.description: Default the Person making the comment to the processing person if not submitted via the web service.

Business_Process_Parameters.description: Captures a comment for the Business Process.

Business_Process_Attachment_Data.description: Free form text comment about the attachment.

validation.validation: This Business Process Type has been configured to not accept Attachment Categories.

Business_Process_Attachment_Data.description: Text attribute identifying Content Type of the Attachment.

Business_Process_Parameters.description: Element for the attachments pertaining to a Event entered through a web service.

validation.validation: This Business Process Type has been configured to not accept Event Attachments.

description: Container for the processing options for a business process. If no options are submitted (or the options are submitted as 'false') then the business process is simply initiated as if it where submitted on-line with approvals, reviews, notifications and to-do's in place. If the Initiator is an Integration System User, any validations you configured on the Initiation step are ignored.

WorkerObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

WorkerObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

validation.validation: The worker has pending actions that conflict with this one. Complete the pending actions before starting this new action.

Switch_Primary_Job_Request_Data.description: Date that the change will be effective

Switch_Primary_Job_Data.description: The worker must have an additional job in order to propose a primary job.When used in a standalone Switch Primary Job web service and the worker has only 1 additional job, Workday will automatically use the new primary job value.In Change Job and Add Additional Job web services, if no value is specified, this field will remain blank.

validation.validation: The proposed primary job has in progress or completed Assign Pay Group business processes after the effective date.
The proposed primary job has an in progress or completed End Additional Job business process preventing the switch.
The worker has a in-progress Switch Primary Job business process. That process must be finished before this one.
The worker has an in progress or completed Termination business process preventing the switch.
Worker has version 1 payroll interface data. Switching the primary for workers with version 1 payroll interface data is not supported.

Proposed primary job submitted is not valid for the Add Additional Job sub event. This value should be sent as blank because the job that will be used as the proposed primary job has not been created yet.
If the parent business process is Change Job on an additional job, then that job must be the proposed primary job.
The current primary job has an in progress or completed Assign Pay Group business process after the effective date.

Workday currently does not support payroll processing for a worker whose primary job belongs to an external pay group and additional job belongs to a Workday pay group.  This switch would result in that situation.
The proposed primary job must have a pay group (either already defined or proposed in the web service).
The proposed primary job has a Workday pay group and the current primary job has an external pay group. The switch is not supported in this case.
The proposed primary job must have a pay group (either already defined or proposed in the web service).
The current primary job must have a pay group (either already defined or proposed in the web service).
The current primary job must have a pay group (either already defined or proposed in the web service).
Effective date of the primary job switch is prior to worker's last completed pay calculation result. The earliest possible date is [date].
The worker has pending actions that conflict with this one. Complete the pending actions before starting this new action.
The proposed primary job submitted is not active for the worker as of the effective date.
Enter an effective date that is after [date], the date of the latest completed Switch Primary Job business process.
The Proposed Primary Job reference is required except when this is a sub process of an Add Additional Employment or a Change Job on an Additional Employment.
The proposed primary job can't be the same as the job that's ending.
You can’t switch the primary job to an international assignment that has a Workday pay group.
Enter a Proposed Primary Job Reference. This field is required for workers with more than 1 active additional job.

description: Wrapper element for the Switch Primary Job web service
